intro: Biscutella laevigata f. lucida, commonly known as the shining biscuitroot, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, cruciform flowers. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, and it produces yellow flowers in early spring. Its small, capsule-like fruits contain numerous tiny seeds. This plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
